message.content:
cs.AI, cs.HC, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.IR. 

The paper proposes a Deep Reinforcement Learning framework for task arrangement in crowdsourcing platforms. This involves personalized recommendation of tasks to workers and maximizing the profit of the platform. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction). The paper also utilizes Deep Q-Network (DQN), which is a popular method in the field of machine learning and falls under the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper deals with dynamic changes and evolving data, which falls under the sub-category of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). Finally, the paper involves predicting transition probabilities and future states, which falls under the sub-category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
